/>

## Properties

| **Property**                        | **Values**                                   | **Default**
|-----------------------------------  |----------------------------------------------| -----------------------------------------------
| Has navigation `Boolean`            | `true \| false`                              | `true`
| State `Variant`                     | `Default \| Hover \| Focus`                  | `Default`
| Selected `Boolean`                  | `true \| false`                              | `false`
| Label `Text`                        | `string`                                     | `1`

## When to use

{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--semantic-icon-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} There is a large amount of content that needs to be split across multiple pages. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--semantic-icon-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} The content is not loaded dynamically. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--semantic-icon-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Users may need to jump to a specific page. <br/><br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--semantic-icon-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Infinite scrolling or a “Load more” button provides a better user experience. <br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--semantic-icon-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} The pages don’t have a logical sequence, for example independent categories instead of continuous content. <br/>

## Size

Dimensions of the breadcrumb are tied to the global `scale` tokens. This ensures that the components with similar size settings remain consistent across the interface. `scale` tokens also provides more granular control over dimensional settings.

```css:scale.css showLineNumbers
--scale-width-<size>
--scale-height-<size>
--scale-padding-<size>
--scale-gap-<size>
--scale-radius-<size>
--scale-icon-size-<size>
--scale-text-size-<size>
--scale-text-height-<size>
```
